activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A Schroedl

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case #21CF535, #21CM378, #22CF107, #22CF161 called at 10:38am.
Defendant Cody A Schroedl appears by videoconferencing from Jackson Correctional Institution, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court verifies with Mr. Schroedl that he can see and hear the proceedings through the video-connection.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that negotiations with the prosecutor have been exhausted; the Defense is requesting the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing at this point.
During scheduling discussions, ADA Teuber indicates that the State will agree to extend its global plea-offer out to the date of 12/6/22.
The Court informs Mr. Schroedl that he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing.  Mr. Schroedl requests that he appear by video-conference at the next hearing. 
recess 10:41am.  

NEXT:  Plea and Sentencing on December 6th at 3:00pm--arrangements are to be made for Mr. Schroedl to appear by video for this hearing
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF535, 21CM378, 22CF107, and 22CF161 called at 2;38PM
Defendant Cody A Schroedl appears via video from the Jackson Correctional Facility, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Att De La Rosa advises that no resolution exists yet, but negations are close to closing, and requests that another Status Conference be scheduled, with possible resolution at that time.

recess 2:42PM

NEXT: Status Conference (possible Plea and Sentencing) on 10/21 at 10:30AM (Defendant may appear via video conferencing for this hearing)

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
NOH has also been provided to Defendant and DCI

[ma] Cases 21CF535,21CM378,22CF107,22CF161 called at 11:30 AM 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cody A Schroedl does NOT appear. 

The Court explains that these cases were scheduled for 10:30am, cases were not called until 11:30am due to calendar congestion, DCI could no longer hold Mr. Schroedl in video room.

Atty De La Rosa requests a pretrial and status be scheduled; due to Mr. Schroedl's imprisonment cases will need to be renegotiated. 
--no objection from DA Hall.

recess: 11:33am
JAs Review of 5/4/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/5/4/22)
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/5/4/22)

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF535, 21CM378, 22CF107, and 22CF161 called at 9:31AM
Defendant Cody A Schroedl in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for Preliminary Hearings, however the Defense files waiver documents prior to the case being called.
The Court proceeds with Waivers of Preliminary Hearings in files 22CF107 and 22CF161:

Mr. Schroedl waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds him over for Trials.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited in both files
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all Counts in both files
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial in either file.

Att De La Rosa advises that the Defendant will likely be in custody at the Dodge Correctional Institute at the time of the next hearing, and requests that the Defendant be allowed to appear remotely. The Court grants this request.

recess 9:40AM

NEXT:   
In all files:
(1) Pretrial Conference on 06/08 at 9:00AM with counsel appearances only   
(2) Status Conference on 06/23 at 10:30AM

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:29PM
Defendant Cody A Schroedl appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Victims #1, #2, or #3 as identified in the Victim/Witness Key
--notify the Clerk of Court's Office of a current mailing address with in 48 hours of release from the Jefferson County Jail

recess 1:38PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 04/20 at 8:30AM   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 04/28 at 9:30AM
